definition: to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: Sit down and plan out a strategy for defeating your doubt.
sentences.chinese: 坐下來然後制定一項擊敗懷疑的計劃。

sentences.english: When pneumothorax occurs temporally with menstrual cycles, catamenial pneumothorax should be suspected.
sentences.chinese: 當氣胸發生在月經來潮時要懷疑胸腔子宮內膜異位症。

sentences.english: He was suspected to be a loner with difficulty experienced during relationships.
sentences.chinese: 他懷疑是孤家寡人的困難所經歷的人際關係。

sentences.english: Be not due on this problem any suspicion and oscillatory .
sentences.chinese: 在這個問題上是不應有任何懷疑和動搖的。

sentences.english: But another part wonders what's next after sitting up straight.
sentences.chinese: 但另一部分又懷疑，坐端正之後又會發生什麼呢？

sentences.english: We must be bold in "hard money" and not to doubt their own.
sentences.chinese: 要敢於“硬幹”，不要懷疑自己。

sentences.english: By September, the gang had begun to suspect it had a mole.
sentences.chinese: 到了9月，這夥人開始懷疑出了內奸。

sentences.english: Horatio most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.
sentences.chinese: 霍雷肖最想它耙我的恐懼和懷疑。

sentences.english: Suspicion chased itself across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉上露出懷疑的神色。

sentences.english: He had ranked himself in the numerous phalanx of unbelievers.
sentences.chinese: 他一直象其它無數懷疑者一樣持懷疑態度。

sentences.english: He had ranked himself in the numerous phalanx of unbelievers.
sentences.chinese: 他一直象其它無數懷疑者一樣持懷疑態度。

sentences.english: When he heard these words, he felt his inner doubts melt away.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這些話時，他感到自己內心的懷疑消失了。

sentences.english: Indeed, I suspect China is quietly laughing at us right now.
sentences.chinese: 確實，我懷疑中國現在正在看着我們偷笑。

sentences.english: We have some doubt whether they can complete the task ontime.
sentences.chinese: 我們懷疑他們是否能準時完成任務。

sentences.english: A fault line of anger and distrust crossed his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒和懷疑在他額頭上刻下了皺紋。

definition: to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
